result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John James Beckman

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John James Beckman in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for John James Beckman.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Jury Trial.  Court will be in trial on another case and unable to hear this case.  Court will adjourn jury trial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 13.  Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Jury trial scheduled for January 23, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant John James Beckman in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for John James Beckman.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Final pretrial conference held.  Parties remain in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled on 10/17/2022 in Branch 13.
CORRECTION: Judge Konkol presided over Branch 13 on September 1st, 2022

Defendant John James Beckman in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for John James Beckman.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Defense is in receipt of discovery and offer and requests a jury trial.
Case adjourned.
Final pre-trial scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant John James Beckman in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel recently appointed and has not received discovery and offer and requests additional time to review.
Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 13. Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with DJ.
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant John James Beckman in court.  Ian F Vance-Curzan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 37 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/13/22 @ 2p
